result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeffrey Allan Mollan #611899 was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Cocaine (>15-40g) [Modifiers: Conspiracy to Commit], a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)3.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Maintain absolute Sobriety.  Submit to an AODA assessment and follow through with recommended AODA treatment and aftercare.  Not enter into an establishment where the primary function is the sale or consumption of alcohol. Not possess illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.  Maintain full time work and or schooling or any combination thereof.  Submit DNA sample.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Sentencing hearing 3-15-17 filed by court reporter Marjorie Kurtz
Filed by Atty Ron Benavides.

Case called at 11:15 a.m. Defendant Jeffrey Allan Mollan  #611899 in court, in custody with attorney Ronald Gabriel Benavides.  Crystal N Long appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties have received PSI - no dispute. Sentencing statements made. Defendant gave statement. Court sentenced defendant to 10 years prison, consisting of 3 years confinement and 7 years extended supervision, consecutive to current sentence serving. Conditions of PSI listed on page 22. $518 costs DNA sample to be submitted. Defendant is eligible for Challenge Academy, is  eligible for Substance Abuse Program. Jail credit to be determined. Court adjourned at 12:07 p.m.
filed by probation agent Tim Quinn

Defendant Jeffrey Allan Mollan  #611899 in court, in custody with attorney Ronald Gabriel Benavides.  Crystal N Long appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties requested a Pre-sentence Investigation be done. Court went over the rights & elements. Defendant pled no contest to count one. Court found defendant guilty, entered judgment. Court ordered a Pre-sentence Investigation. Sentencing to be set after receipt of PSI, approximately 60 days out.
